content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the increasing function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals x cubed, plus 2 times x squared, plus 4 x, plus 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="f of negative 1, equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the inverse function of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following is a correct expression for <math alttext="g prime of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="g prime of 2, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator f prime of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="g prime of 2, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator f prime of negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="g prime of 2, equals, f prime of negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="g prime of 2, equals, f prime of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="g prime of 2, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator f prime of negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.G: Confirm that solutions are accurate and appropriate.
